  16. /* Operating system - specific stuff */

  18. #ifndef CAML_OSDEPS_H
  19. ‌#define CAML_OSDEPS_H

  21. #ifdef _WIN32
  22. #include <time.h>

  24. extern unsigned short caml_win32_major;
  25. extern unsigned short caml_win32_minor;
  26. extern unsigned short caml_win32_build;
  27. extern unsigned short caml_win32_revision;
  28. #endif

  30. #ifdef CAML_INTERNALS

  32. #include "misc.h"
  33. #include "memory.h"

  35. ‌#define Io_interrupted (-1)

  37. /* Read at most [n] bytes from file descriptor [fd] into buffer [buf].
  38.    [flags] indicates whether [fd] is a socket
  39.    (bit [CHANNEL_FLAG_FROM_SOCKET] is set in this case, see [io.h]).
  40.    (This distinction matters for Win32, but not for Unix.)
  41.    Return number of bytes read.
  42.    In case of error, raises [Sys_error] or [Sys_blocked_io].
  43.    If interrupted by a signal and no bytes where read, returns
  44.    Io_interrupted without raising. */
  45. extern int caml_read_fd(int fd, int flags, void * buf, int n);

  47. /* Write at most [n] bytes from buffer [buf] onto file descriptor [fd].
  48.    [flags] indicates whether [fd] is a socket
  49.    (bit [CHANNEL_FLAG_FROM_SOCKET] is set in this case, see [io.h]).
  50.    (This distinction matters for Win32, but not for Unix.)
  51.    Return number of bytes written.
  52.    In case of error, raises [Sys_error] or [Sys_blocked_io].
  53.    If interrupted by a signal and no bytes were written, returns
  54.    Io_interrupted without raising. */
  55. extern int caml_write_fd(int fd, int flags, void * buf, int n);

  57. /* Decompose the given path into a list of directories, and add them
  58.    to the given table. */
  59. extern char_os * caml_decompose_path(struct ext_table * tbl, char_os * path);

  61. /* Search the given file in the given list of directories.
  62.    If not found, return a copy of [name]. */
  63. extern char_os * caml_search_in_path(struct ext_table * path,
  64.                                      const char_os * name);

  66. /* Same, but search an executable name in the system path for executables. */
  67. CAMLextern char_os * caml_search_exe_in_path(const char_os * name);

  69. /* Same, but search a shared library in the given path. */
  70. extern char_os * caml_search_dll_in_path(struct ext_table * path,
  71.                                          const char_os * name);

  73. /* Open a shared library and return a handle on it.
  74.    If [global] is true, symbols from the shared library can be used
  75.    to resolve for other libraries to be opened later on.
  76.    Return [NULL] on error. */
  77. extern void * caml_dlopen(char_os * libname, int global);

  79. /* Close a shared library handle */
  80. extern void caml_dlclose(void * handle);

  82. /* Look up the given symbol in the given shared library.
  83.    Return [NULL] if not found, or symbol value if found. */
  84. extern void * caml_dlsym(void * handle, const char * name);

  86. extern void * caml_globalsym(const char * name);

  88. /* Return an error message describing the most recent dynlink failure. */
  89. extern char * caml_dlerror(void);

  91. /* Recover executable name if possible (/proc/sef/exe under Linux,
  92.    GetModuleFileName under Windows).  Return NULL on error,
  93.    string allocated with [caml_stat_alloc] on success. */
  94. extern char_os * caml_executable_name(void);

  96. /* Secure version of [getenv]: returns NULL if the process has special
  97.    privileges (setuid bit, setgid bit, capabilities).
  98. */
  99. extern char_os *caml_secure_getenv(char_os const *var);

  101. /* If [fd] refers to a terminal or console, return the number of rows
  102.    (lines) that it displays.  Otherwise, or if the number of rows
  103.    cannot be determined, return -1. */
  104. extern int caml_num_rows_fd(int fd);

  106. /* Memory management platform-specific operations */

  108. void *caml_plat_mem_map(uintnat, uintnat, int);
  109. void *caml_plat_mem_commit(void *, uintnat);
  110. void caml_plat_mem_decommit(void *, uintnat);
  111. void caml_plat_mem_unmap(void *, uintnat);

  116. CAMLextern int caml_win32_unlink(const wchar_t *);

  118. extern void caml_probe_win32_version(void);
  119. extern void caml_setup_win32_terminal(void);
  120. extern void caml_restore_win32_terminal(void);

  122. extern wchar_t *caml_win32_getenv(wchar_t const *);

  124. /* Windows Unicode support */

  126. CAMLextern int caml_win32_multi_byte_to_wide_char(const char* s,
  127.                                                   int slen,
  128.                                                   wchar_t *out,
  129.                                                   int outlen);
  130. CAMLextern int caml_win32_wide_char_to_multi_byte(const wchar_t* s,
  131.                                                   int slen,
  132.                                                   char *out,
  133.                                                   int outlen);

  135. /* Legacy names */

  137. ‌#define win_wide_char_to_multi_byte caml_win32_wide_char_to_multi_byte

  139. CAMLextern int caml_win32_isatty(int fd);

  141. CAMLextern void caml_expand_command_line (int *, wchar_t ***);

  143. CAMLextern clock_t caml_win32_clock(void);

  145. #endif /* _WIN32 */

  147. /* Returns the current value of a counter that increments once per nanosecond.
  148.    On systems that support it, this uses a monotonic timesource which ignores
  149.    changes in the system time (so that this counter increases by 1000000 each
  150.    millisecond, even if the system clock was set back by an hour during that
  151.    millisecond). This makes it useful for benchmarking and timeouts, but not
  152.    for telling the time. The units are always nanoseconds, but the achieved
  153.    resolution may be less. The starting point is unspecified. */
  154. extern int64_t caml_time_counter(void);

  156. extern void caml_init_os_params(void);

  158. #endif /* CAML_INTERNALS */

  160. #ifdef _WIN32

  162. /* [caml_stat_strdup_to_utf16(s)] returns a NULL-terminated copy of [s],
  163.    re-encoded in UTF-16.  The encoding of [s] is assumed to be UTF-8 if
  164.    [caml_windows_unicode_runtime_enabled] is non-zero **and** [s] is valid
  165.    UTF-8, or the current Windows code page otherwise.

  167.    The returned string is allocated with [caml_stat_alloc], so it should be free
  168.    using [caml_stat_free].
  169. */
  170. CAMLextern wchar_t* caml_stat_strdup_to_utf16(const char *s);

  172. /* [caml_stat_strdup_of_utf16(s)] returns a NULL-terminated copy of [s],
  173.    re-encoded in UTF-8 if [caml_windows_unicode_runtime_enabled] is non-zero or
  174.    the current Windows code page otherwise.

  176.    The returned string is allocated with [caml_stat_alloc], so it should be free
  177.    using [caml_stat_free].
  178. */
  179. CAMLextern char* caml_stat_strdup_of_utf16(const wchar_t *s);

  181. /* [caml_copy_string_of_utf16(s)] returns an OCaml string containing a copy of
  182.    [s] re-encoded in UTF-8 if [caml_windows_unicode_runtime_enabled] is non-zero
  183.    or in the current code page otherwise.
  184. */
  185. CAMLextern value caml_copy_string_of_utf16(const wchar_t *s);

  187. #endif /* _WIN32 */

  189. #endif /* CAML_OSDEPS_H */
